The main content grid needs to adapt to how the markup changes between the mobile and desktop versions.

// Whoa, got sucked into it for a while there, my coffee got cold, and thatâ€™s nothing to say about the coffee. Daveâ€™s Roastery, Blind Pig Blend. Decent stuff. Fresh enough beans at least, and itâ€™s got a bit of pop to it.

Just busted out so much React! I had the whole markup in HTML for mobile and desktop, now the mobile is converted, even if the components havenâ€™t been fleshed out yet, and the state for mobile/desktop is set up â€¦ itâ€™s been a few hours, though, thatâ€™s about what I can do for the moment, breakfast and walking Dawa again need to happen. ğŸ˜ƒ

//Oh, man â€¦ so Dawa and I got to Harkness, though I allowed us to abbreviate the run slightly. Eighty-one degrees and feeling like eighty-five is a lot for the little guy, but at least he got the bike rides in. I think my legs are going to fall off.

Back to the markup! Mobile was a veritable joy to bring over to React, once I got into the swing of it! Desktop and diffing time! // Yay! Index is 500 lines, but itâ€™s semantic! Iâ€™m going to just try running it and see what it yells at me for!

Canâ€™t resolve â€˜sweetGradient.jpgâ€™ â€¦ probably didnâ€™t use a jpg â€¦ correct, png.

Canâ€™t resolve â€™../../siteMetadataâ€™ â€¦ well itâ€™s not two levels up â€¦

Canâ€™t resolve â€˜delightButton.svgâ€™ â€¦ ah, well, I hadnâ€™t made it yet â€¦ alright, +1 for The Noun Project â€¦

â€˜/dogâ€™ â€¦ â€˜/dog.svgâ€™ â€¦ â€˜/navIndicator.svgâ€™ â€¦

Could not find files for / in .next/build-manifest.json ? Rut roh â€¦ try yarn build â€¦ Gatsby? Oh, delete DepNav.js â€¦ named import for fs? Noo â€¦ why are we not finding fs? Okay, maybe because Iâ€™m callin an import from ./lib outside of the special next methods â€¦ okay, Credits is not defined? Okay â€¦ now codingref.current is undefined?

Oh snap, it rendered! Itâ€™s still in the loading state though â€¦ hmm â€¦ Going into the depths of useEffect, lol â€¦ Okay, THIS one may have been an effect of using Python, I put a negation in a place that doesnâ€™t make sense in JS â€¦ aaand you actually have to call Math.random() â€¦ AppWrap not defined â€¦ back around to random â€¦ Title isnâ€™t defined â€¦ TabsWrap â€¦ three more components â€¦ two more â€¦ okay break time â€¦

/// Oof, nope, that was done time. Okay, so from early tomorrow morning, from then, what did we learn yesterday? Donâ€™t put random things in lib, itâ€™s all looked at during the build, if youâ€™re pulling from there from client side code, thatâ€™s bad. More than that, for sure, that was a good one though, and I have to take Dawa out, so signing out for now and back in in the next post! Best wishes! ~g

frontmatter.title: Order Of Operations
frontmatter.description: In which our morning starts with #Dawa { visibility: visible !important; }
